Sub: Best screener of the month: Reg.

Pre-embarkation security check is a significant component of anti-hijacking
duties being performed by the ASG of CISF. Over a period of time, our screeners
have constantly enhanced their skills in detection of prohibited items in the hand
baggage of the passengers and worked dedicatedly in the interest of organisation.
In addition, they have also successfully detected dummy/decoy checks conducted by
various agencies. It is felt that a system of continuously applauding their efforts be
introduced to motivate them by identifying “Best Screener of the Month” from each
of the ASGs under CISF cover.

2. _ In order to implement the system, the following directions are hereby issued
for selection and identification of “Best Screener of the Month”:

i) A Board headed by CASO of the ASG may be constituted along with shift
GO I/C and SHA I/C to identify and select the best screeners of the
month. They will assess the performance of screeners based on
following parameters:

Projection (TIP) software available in X-ray machines as per

b) Operational attributes: Knowledge about security gadgets and its
operationalability. General awareness on various rules and guidelines
pertaining to pre-embarkation security checks:

Excellent = 10 marks
Very good = 08 marks
Satisfactory = 06 marks
Average = Nil

¢) Personal attributes: Individual's performance as a team,
cooperation and inter-personal relations with PESC staff. Attitude to
work & sense of responsibility as well as maintenance of discipline.

Excellent = 10 marks
Very good = 08 marks
Satisfactory = 06 marks
Average = Nil

d) Notable detection: Besides above parameters, if any significant
detection (without input) has been made viz: detection of weapons,
explosives, IEDs, contraband items etc, the same will be considered
over the parameters (a, b & c) for adjudging the best screeners of
the month. If such detections have been made by more than one
screener in a month in any ASG, then above mentioned parameters
may also be taken into consideration for adjudging.

3. It would be the responsibility of the CASOs to display the name and
photograph of the best screener of the month in poster size (46 cm X 61 cm)
conspicuously, at a prominent place. Such recognition will encourage other
personnel of the ASG to emulate the achievement/good work done by their
colleague. CASOs may also explore possibility whether the same can be displayed on
the screens installed at the airports. Best screener of the month should be given a
reward of Rs. 500/- by the DIG and if any person achieves the distinction of getting
05 best screener awards in a calendar year then his name shall be sent for DG’s
reward,

4. Al CASOs are directed to ensure implementation of these instructions in letter
and spirit and Airport Sector should monitor implementation of the same at all ASGs.
